parameters: Fade out the screen and show the black bars for the cinematic effect.
Since we aren't using the player, we're going to need to halt
his movement and prevent menu opening, to do this we can simply
use a switch. Without this happening, the player can click to
move the player which will reveal the box-clicky thing
switch to stop movement and prevent opening menu
Change the blank events to mimick our party, set their location, and
make our current party hidden. Uncheck "wait for completion" in set movement
change screens tint and start a screen scroll, then fade in
First, we'll tint it all the way black to make the smooth
Now we fade in the screen to the desired color for 120 frames, or 2 seconds
Move the new party to the left, just before the baddy jumps down
and stops them. Uncheck wait for completion once again and estimate
or playtest to find out how many frames you'll need to wait before
the next action. We want harold to face Therese before she's done moving.
This can also be done in set move rout for harold, but either way works
For therese's last step, we're going to make her walk a bit
We start the dialogue. Make sure the window is transparent, and
you only use the 2 bottom lines of text. We're going to use show
picture to slide in the emotes
-- Start the picture at 734 x and 530 y
Slide it to 730 x and 530 y for about 20 frames, don't wait for
Lords and ladies welcome to the trial of Lord Ormond, Lord Halacre and Lord - \|\|\^
- Mustel. They all stand accused of treason. We will do our best to find the - \|\|\^
- truth among the lies. First let’s pray. Will the high priest do us the honour. \|\|\^
We come before the gods! We call for justice! Judgement! And truth! We ask for - \|\|\^
- you to guide us on the righteous path so that we may be pure. Let those of - \|\|\^
- darkness be separated from those who carry the light of the gods. For we will - \|\|\^
- act as a torch in search of those who are lost trying to find a way back. \|\|\^
Thank you High Priest. We now call forth Lord Ormond. You are aware you - \|\|\^
I have committed no such thing. \|\|\^
Is that all you have to say? \|\|\^
Yes. I am innocent of all charges. \|\|\^
Did you not support Prince Lansee during the war of the three princes? \|\|\^
I supported his brothers. I wasn’t sure of the situation. \|\|\^
But you were aware of the fact Prince Lansee was the rightful heir? \|\|\^
Yes. But I was still loyal to their family. \|\|\^
That has been noted. Did you support Roswell’s control over Rinsar? \|\|\^
Well I didn’t see an alternative our royal household had been wiped out. Two of - \|\|\^
- them by Lord Cedric. Besides, it was also Lord Cedric and Lord Roswell who - \|\|\^
- put Roswell in control. They are to blame for the tragedies that followed. \|\|\^
Thank you Lord Ormond, we are done asking your questions. \|\|\^

We call forth Lord Halacre. You are aware of the changes against you? \|\|\^
Did you support Prince Lansee or his brothers during the war of the three - \|\|\^
I supported the brothers. I thought Prince Lansee was going to lose so I picked - \|\|\^
- the brothers. I am sure you are aware of how events would have turned out - \|\|\^
- if I wasn’t supporting them and they had won the war. \|\|\^
We hear that Lord Halacre. Did you support Roswell? \|\|\^
Yes I did he was who was put in power and didn’t go against Rinsar. \|\|\^
Thank you Lord Halacre. That is all for now. \|\|\^

We call forth Lord Mustel. Are you aware of why you stand trial? \|\|\^
Did you support the heir apparent Prince Lansee or his brothers? \|\|\^
I supported his brothers. I thought it was the right thing to do. I now know - \|\|\^
We will take that into consideration. Did you support Roswell? \|\|\^
I supported Roswell. He seemed like the best solution for Rinsar. \|\|\^
Thank you. Lord Mustel we will get back to you. \|\|\^

We now call forth Lord Cedric. \|\|\^
Did you support Prince Lansee or his brothers during the war of the three - \|\|\^
I supported Prince Lansee. He was the rightful heir to the throne of Rinsar. - \|\|\^
Initially yes, it was my brother and I who put him in power after the war of the - \|\|\^
- three kings had ceased. But when he turned and began to take power invading - \|\|\^
- the other kingdoms I withdrew my support and began finding a way to - \|\|\^
- remove him. I approached Lord Ormond, Lord Halacre and Lord Mustel. They all - \|\|\^
- refused to help saying they believed he should rule as it benefited them. \|\|\^
Did Roswell ever tell you of his intentions? \|\|\^
No not really after he had invaded most of the kingdoms he began to open - \|\|\^
- up about his goals but he didn’t say much. Then I killed him. \|\|\^
Thank you Lord Cedric. That will be all. \|\|\^

We will now take some time to make a decision. On the charges of treason we - \|\|\^
- find Lord Ormond, Lord Halacre and Lord Mustel guilty of conspiring against - \|\|\^
- the interests of the crown and the people of Rinsar. The punishment will be - \|\|\^
- public execution. Lord Cedric will act as executioner as he is a Lord who can - \|\|\^
- carry out the sentence. Are you okay with that Lord Cedric? \|\|\^
You obtained Judge Campion's Entry in the Journal.
